commitResults.messageBody:
Input from users may not follow recognizable pattern.

Add exceptions from HahaException class to handle undesirable input.

Include exception classes for better organization of errors.

This also completes A-Exceptions extension.

Add delete function to remove specified task.

Fix test typos.

Extensions: A-Collections, A-Exceptions and A-Inheritance are completed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Major Revamp: A-Enums and Code refactor
commitResults.messageBody:
All related code to storing of tasks and parsing of input are within the
class Haha

Restructure and create the following classes:
- TaskType enum to specify all possible task types
- LegitCommand enum to specify all accepted commands
- Parser class to deal with sanitizing input
- Database class to deal with modifying of task records
- A few specific exceptions that inherit from HahaException

Extra:
- Still not happy with code structure within subclass
- May decide to modify code in Parser for better organization
and fit OOP style

Data about tasks are stored in memory and will not preserve to the next
section.

Let's write existing data about user's todo into a file under
current working directory and into /data/database.txt

This is to ensure on starting up the program again, data can be read
from the file and display to users.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parse date and time for user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Date and time are treated as pure string, which cannot be parsed and
compared later on.

Let's parse the input string and store date and time information as
LocalDate and LocalTime object. Also formatting is applied when printing
the information.

This helps users to see the date and time information easily.

Different components are within the Haha class and  this might cause
confusion and increase difficulty in managing code.

Let's apply OOP style and extract out four classes: Ui, Storage, Parser
and TaskList.

This is to separate different logic into different files.

Classes not organized.

Let's package all files into a single package, tlylt.haha.

This helps for code organisation.

Current program only tested with text-ui-test, which may not be enough.

Let's add Junit tests to increase testing and hence ensure program is
correct.

Test cases for Ui and Parser classes are added to ensure they work as
expected.

commitResults.messageTitle: Package the App as a JAR file
commitResults.messageBody:
Program needs to be compiled to run and this is not user friendly.

Let's fix the storage and package up the program for release as a JAR
file.

This allows users to download and use the program easily.

Without Gradle support, the build needs to be built manually.

Let's add Gradle support to automate build processes.

This allows for automation in building and testing.

Manual checking of code style violations can be ineffective.

Let's use Gradle to add checkstyle support.

This allows running of checkstyle as a Gradle task.

Without GUI, the display can be quite limited.

Let's add a GUI using JavaFX.

Users can now type into the input box and see a response in a chat bot
style.
